content: अंजलिः [अंज्-अलि <ls>Uṇ. 4. 2</ls>] {@--1@} A cavity formed by folding and joining the open hands together, the hollow of the hands; hence, a cavity-ful of anything (changed to अंजल or °लि after द्वि and त्रि in द्विगु <ab>comp.</ab>, <ls>P. V. 4. 102</ls>); न वार्यंजलिना पिबेत् <ls>Ms. 4. 63</ls>; सुपूरो मूषिकांजंलिः <ls>Pt. 1. 25</ls>; अरण्यबीजांजलिदानलालिताः <ls>Ku. 5. 15</ls>; प्रकीर्णः पुष्पाणां हरिचरणयोरंजालेरंयं <ls>Ve. 1. 1</ls> a cavityful of flowers; so जलस्यांजलयो दश <ls>Y. 3. 105</ls> 10 cavity-fuls or libations of water; श्रवणांजलिपुटपेयं <ls>Ve. 1. 4</ls> to be drunk by the cavity of the ear; अंजलिं रच्, बंध्, कृ or आधा fold the hands together and raise them to the head in supplication or salutation; बद्धः कातर्यादरविंदकुड्मलनिभो मुग्धः प्रणामांजलिः <ls>U. 3. 37.</ls> {@--2@} Hence a mark of respect or salutation; कः शक्रेण कृतं नेच्छेदधिमूर्धानमंजलिम् <ls>Bk. 8. 84</ls>; बध्यतामभययाचनांजलिः <ls>R. 11. 78.</ls> {@--3@} A measure of corn = कुडव; another measure = प्रसृत, or one-half of a मानिका.
